div.div: Μέντωρ : Mentor.—(1) an Ithacan, the son of Alcimus, a near friend of Odysseus, to whom Odysseus intrusts the oversight of his household during his absence. Under the form of Mentor, Athēna guides Telemachus on his travels in search of his father, and helps him to baffle the suitors; in other words she makes herself his mentor, Od. 2.225, 243, Od. 3.22, 340, Od. 22.206, 208, Od. 24.446.—(2) father of Imbrius, under whose form Apollo incites Hector to battle, Il. 13.171.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
